column4: Hi everybody. I have problems on my notebook (MSI MegaBook MS-1325). Sometimes sound turns into scratchy noise, but does not completely disappear though. To fix this I had to reboot, but I've found an alternative solution. It helps when on Sound Preferences > Hardware I change Profile from "Analog Stereo Output" to e.g. "Digital Stereo Duplex" and then back again. I'd like to turn this...

...action into a script and put it on Panel in order to do quick fixing (because I don't know a better permanent solution). The question is can anyone give me a hint about what happens (what commands are executed, or which commands could give same result) when I change that setting? ("alsa-utils restart" is not the thing I search for, it doesn't help, it's something else) Or maybe you could...
...point me at place where I can find sources for Sound Preferences application?
Please don't flood, use http://paste.ubuntu.com to paste, don't use Enter as punctuation.
